answers.answer: Yeah, that ***** and is very unprofessional! I'd say just wait for labor signs then go to the nearest hospital instead of dealing with that!
I'd make sure you're at least monitoring your bp yourself in case you start having signs of preeclampsia. But good luck. That really *****.
Yea thats very unprofessional and im sorry you have to deal with that. Continue to check ur bp and i hope everything works out
Swelling in the face and hands is a more noticeable sign of preeclampsia.

question: So as the weather gets worse and the office closes the doctor decides to take days off and not call to reschedule.  I have missed my last three appointments.  They are so unprofessional, I have tried to get in with another doctor but because I am so far along they won't take me. I am just fed up and ready to just not see a doctor until I give birth. Heck all they do is tell me how much weight I have gained, make me pee in a cup and send me on my way!!! So far I have had an amazing pregnancy so there has been no need to run to the doctors or fear anything is wrong. I just need to vent, thanks for listening!
title: 35 was and haven't seen doc in a month
